verses.roman:
arthasya sādhane siddhe
utkarṣe rakṣaṇe vyaye
nāśopabhoga āyāsas
trāsaś cintā bhramo nṛṇām

synonyms: arthaysa—of wealth; sādhane—in the earning; siddhe—in the attainment; utkarṣe—in the increasing; rakṣaṇe—in the protecting; vyaye—in the expending; nāśa—in the loss; upabhoge—and in the enjoyment; āyāsaḥ—labor; trāsaḥ—fear; cintā—anxiety; bhramaḥ—confusion; nṛṇām—for men.
translation: In the earning, attainment, increase, protection, expense, loss and enjoyment of wealth, all men experience great labor, fear, anxiety and delusion.
